action.action-desc: Ms. Schakowsky (for herself, Mr. Sean Patrick Maloney of New York, Ms. Kuster of New Hampshire, Ms. Tsongas, and Mr. Lynch) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Power Act to establish an Office of Public Participation and Consumer Advocacy.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Public Engagement at FERC Act.

section.header: Office of Public Participation and Consumer Advocacy
section.text: Section 319 of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 825q–1) is amended to read as follows:

section.header: Office of Public Participation and Consumer Advocacy

paragraph.text: The term Advisory Committee means the Public and Consumer Advocacy Advisory Committee established under subsection (f)(1).
The term energy customer means a residential customer or a small commercial customer that receives products or services from—

subparagraph.text: a public utility or natural gas company under the jurisdiction of the Commission; or
an electric cooperative.

paragraph.text: The term natural gas company has the meaning given the term natural-gas company in section 2 of the Natural Gas Act (15 U.S.C. 717a), as modified by section 601(a)(1)(C) of the Natural Gas Policy Act of 1978 (15 U.S.C. 3431(a)(1)(C)).
The term Office means the Office of Public Participation and Consumer Advocacy established by subsection (b).
The term public utility has the meaning given the term in section 201(e).

subsection.text: There is established within the Commission an office, to be known as the Office of Public Participation and Consumer Advocacy.

paragraph.text: The Office shall be headed by a Director, to be appointed by the President by and with the advice and consent of the Senate from among individuals who—

subparagraph.text: are licensed attorneys admitted to the bar of—
have experience relating to public utility proceedings.

paragraph.text: The Director shall coordinate assistance made available to—

subparagraph.text: the public, with respect to authorities exercised by the Commission; and
individuals and entities intervening or participating, or proposing to intervene or participate, in proceedings before the Commission.

The Director shall be compensated at a rate equal to the daily equivalent of the annual rate of basic pay prescribed for level IV of the Executive Schedule under section 5315 of title 5, United States Code.
The Director may—

subclause.text: not more than 125 full-time professional employees at appropriate levels of the General Schedule; and
such additional support personnel as the Director determines to be necessary; and

clause.text: procure for the Office such temporary and intermittent services as the Director determines to be necessary.

paragraph.text: intervene, appear, and participate, in accordance with this section, in administrative, regulatory, or judicial proceedings on behalf of energy customers with respect to any matter concerning the rates, charges, prices, tariffs, or service of public utilities and natural gas companies, or natural gas siting and infrastructure development, under the jurisdiction of the Commission by representing the interests of the energy customers—

subparagraph.text: on any matter before the Commission concerning rates or service of such a public utility or natural gas company; or
as amicus curiae in—

clause.text: a review in any United States court of a ruling by the Commission in such a matter; or
a hearing or proceeding in any other Federal regulatory agency or commission relating to such a matter;

paragraph.text: support public participation in the siting and permitting of natural gas storage and distribution infrastructure under the jurisdiction of the Commission;
monitor and review energy customer complaints and grievances on matters concerning rates or service of public utilities and natural gas companies under the jurisdiction of the Commission;

investigate independently, or within the context of a formal proceeding, the services provided by, the rates charged by, and the valuation of the properties of, public utilities and natural gas companies under the jurisdiction of the Commission;

employ means, such as public dissemination of information, consultative services, and technical assistance, to ensure, to the maximum extent practicable, that the interests of energy customers are adequately represented in the course of any hearing or proceeding described in paragraph (1);
collect data concerning rates or service of public utilities and natural gas companies under the jurisdiction of the Commission;
prepare and issue reports and recommendations; and
take such other actions as the Director of the Office determines to be necessary to ensure just and reasonable rates for energy customers.

subsection.header: Information from Federal departments and agencies

paragraph.text: The Director of the Office may secure directly from a Federal department or agency such information as the Director considers to be necessary to carry out this section.
On request of the Director under paragraph (1), the head of a Federal department or agency shall provide the information to the Office, to the extent practicable and authorized by law.

subsection.header: Public and Consumer Advocacy Advisory Committee

paragraph.text: The Director of the Office shall establish an advisory committee, to be known as the Public and Consumer Advocacy Advisory Committee—

subparagraph.text: to review rates, services, and disputes; and
to make recommendations to the Director.

paragraph.text: The Advisory Committee shall—

subparagraph.text: be composed of such members as the Director determines to be appropriate; but
include not fewer than—

clause.text: 2 individuals representing State utility consumer advocates; and
1 individual representing a nongovernmental organization that represents consumers.

paragraph.text: The Advisory Committee shall meet at such frequency as is required to carry out the duties of the Advisory Committee.
The Director shall publish the recommendations of the Advisory Committee on the public Internet website established for the Office.
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, the Advisory Committee shall continue in operation during the period for which the Office exists.
Except as otherwise specifically provided, the Advisory Committee shall be subject to the Federal Advisory Committee Act (5 U.S.C. App.).

subsection.text: As the Director of the Office determines to be appropriate, the Office shall issue to the Commission and entities subject to regulation by the Commission reports and guidance—

paragraph.text: regarding market practices;
proposing improvements in Commission monitoring of market practices; and
addressing potential improvements to industry and Commission practices.

subsection.text: The Office shall promote, through outreach, publications, and, as appropriate, direct communication with entities regulated by the Commission—

paragraph.text: improved compliance with Commission rules and orders; and
public participation in the siting and permitting of natural gas storage and distribution infrastructure under the jurisdiction of the Commission.

subsection.header: Compensation to eligible recipients for intervention or participation

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term eligible recipient means an individual or entity—

subparagraph.text: that intervenes or participates in any proceeding before the Commission;
the intervention or participation of which substantially contributed to the approval, in whole or in part, of a position advocated by the individual or entity in the proceeding; and
that is—

clause.text: a representative of the interests of energy customers.

paragraph.text: Subject to paragraph (3), the Commission, in accordance with regulations promulgated by the Commission, may provide to any eligible recipient compensation for reasonable attorney fees, expert witness fees, and other costs of intervening or participating in the applicable proceeding before the Commission.
The Commission may only provide compensation under paragraph (2) if the Commission determines that—

subparagraph.text: the applicable proceeding is significant;
the compensation is approved by the Advisory Committee; and
the intervention or participation by the eligible recipient in the proceeding without receipt of compensation constitutes a significant financial hardship to the eligible recipient.

subsection.text: Nothing in this section restricts or otherwise affects—

paragraph.text: any right or obligation of an intervenor, participant, State utility consumer advocate, energy customer, or group of energy customers under any other applicable provision of law (including regulations); or
the work of Commission trial staff in representing the public interest and pursuing appropriate resolutions in contested matters before the Commission.

subsection.text: Of the amounts received by the Commission for fiscal year 2017 and each fiscal year thereafter as a result of any fee imposed by the Commission, the Commission shall use such sums as are necessary to establish and provide for the operation of the Office under this section.
